root.publications: Dryer, Matthew S. 2005. Genealogical Language List. In Bernard Comrie, Matthew S. Dryer, David Gil & Martin Haspelmath (eds.), The World Atlas of Language Structures, 631-632. New York: Oxford University Press. ISBN 0199255911
root.pub-comments: WALS doesn't distinguish between languages and dialects, so all lects are called languages, but where Ethnologue considers something a dialect, it has been given a dialect code, and there is a comment.
